definition: to rub/to grind/to polish/to sharpen/to wear down/to die out/to waste time/to pester/to insist
to rub/to grind/to polish/to sharpen/to wear down/to die out/to waste time/to pester/to insist
to rub against/to walk slowly/(coll.) to freeload
to rub against/to walk slowly/(coll.) to freeload

sentences.english: He has been pissing around with the task for more than one week.
sentences.chinese: 他磨磨蹭蹭地做那項工作已經1個多星期了。

sentences.english: For a month the governer had dilly- dallied over the choice of a succe or.
sentences.chinese: 州長對於選擇繼任者磨磨蹭蹭了一個月。

sentences.english: Don't drag your feet on this deadline.
sentences.chinese: 你不要在這最後期限的緊急關頭磨磨蹭蹭。

sentences.english: If you dillydally about any longer,we shall miss our plane.
sentences.chinese: 如果你再磨磨蹭蹭的話，我們要誤飛機了。

sentences.english: There are costs to all this dilly-dallying.
sentences.chinese: 一味磨磨蹭蹭是要付出代價的。

sentences.english: The eurozone has fiddled until Rome itself started to burn.
sentences.chinese: 歐元區一直在磨磨蹭蹭，直到羅馬着火。

sentences.english: For a month the governer had dilly- dallied over the choice of a successor.
sentences.chinese: 州長對於選擇繼任者磨磨蹭蹭了一個月。

sentences.english: Don't loaf ; please get the job done.
sentences.chinese: 別磨磨蹭蹭，請把工作做完。

sentences.english: What the devil made you stand lingering there in the wet?
sentences.chinese: 真是見鬼，你們站在雨中磨磨蹭蹭的幹什麼？

definition: to rub lightly/to move slowly/to dawdle/to dillydally/to pester/to nag
(dialect) to dawdle/to waste time/also written 墨跡|墨迹[mo4 ji5]
to swear while talking/to be foul-mouthed
